laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated serum estradiol levels at 30 pmol/L in patient 1 at age 12 years 5 months. For patient 2, serum estradiol levels were below the limits of detection at both 4 years and 9 years of age.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1 showed elevated estradiol at 12.5 years and patient 2 remained below detection limits at ages 4 and 9.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Enlarged testes, 3.5 mL on the right and 2.8 mL on the left. Microlithiasis identified.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Annual ultrasound findings did not change significantly over the 6-year follow-up period.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Loss of heterozygosity of STK11 gene, absence of p21 expression, increased expression of aromatase, and decreased phosphorylation of AMPK in Sertoli cells.

laboratory_examinations.date: 12.5 years of age (for patient 1) and at 4 years of age (for patient 2)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Heterozygous mutation in STK11 (910delC) identified for patient 1. Mutation identified for patient 2: c.180C > T, causing complete loss of the kinase and C-terminal domains.
